bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, February 1, 1930

div1.p: Carter thanks Frost for a reference and expresses her enthusiasm that the final copy of the manuscript of the History of Yellow Fever is being typed.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, February 1, 1930
div1.opener:
Book.
Bibliography
Frost.
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
February 1, 1930.
Dr. Wade H. Frost,
School of Hygiene and Public Health,
615 North Wolfe Street,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Dear Jack:
div1.p:
Thank you and Miss Frederick very much for sending me the
reference cards on (a) Rey, H. (1878) and (b) Iglesias y Pardo, Luis (18
Also for the copy of my typewritten note to you re infection of Fer-
nando Po by the Rosa del Turia (1866) (Section iii, p. i. page 5 of
Father's MS).

The reference from Rey is correct and I had no intention of
pursuing further investigation on the subject. I wished to see the
cards solely in order to change our reference (as per your instructions)
from Iglesias y Pardo (iii, i. 5) to Rey, H., quoting Iglesias y Pardo.

It was good of you to remember to tell me that Mrs. Smiley is
now working on the final copy of the manuscript and “making good
progress.” Such news makes amends for much.

Love to “the Susans.” I am glad to be able to think of the
three of you as being together to-day.

closer.seg:
P. S. I have gotten “cross bearings” on some further points on
which you wished additional information and will send them on within
a few days.
L. A. C.
